discussion.content: Filament is the material used in 3D printers, which you can consider the equivalent of ink in an inkjet printer. If you ever hear the word 'filament' used, you should automatically assume 3D printer.
thanks hey

questions.question_text: An end user reports a printer error that states `Replace filament`. With which of the following types of printer is the end user MOST likely having problems?
Which of the following features will save the battery life of a laptop significantly if they are disabled? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Both cellular and Bluetooth are wireless communication features that consume a significant amount of power when enabled. Disabling these features can help conserve battery life, especially if they are not being used.
Why not volume and cellular
Makes sense since blue tooth and cellular never turn off and would be constantly TX/RX for a signal if available. Honestly never thought to do this myself.
D&E are the right answers here

Think of the gentleman or lady at your local supermarket that pulls out their phone to make their payment. This is an examle of NFC (Near Field Communication). NFC is a two way communication between two devices that enables the user to send data (generally transactions) to a very close by device.

Technically LTE, since it enables general web connectivity, can also be used for making purchases, but yes, the answer they're looking for here is NFC. If the question were written perfectly it would say "for POINT-OF-SALE wireless payments", but hey, they don't wanna make the test TOO easy.

On an interesting side-note, if you google "point-of-sale", google shows an image of a woman conducting an NFC transaction by holding her phone up to a POS device at a cash register.

questions.question_text: Which of the following technologies can be used for wireless payments?

choices.A: A dual-processor motherboard with six hyperthreaded cores each.
choices.D: A single-processor motherboard with ten overclocked cores.
choices.C: A dual-processor motherboard with eight overclocked cores each.
choices.B: A single-processor motherboard with eight hyperthreaded cores.

questions.question_text:
A technician is ordering a new motherboard and processors for a company email server. When reviewing the vendor licensing agreement, the technician sees that there is a flat per-socket licensing fee.
Which of the following motherboard/processor combinations should the technician order to get the BEST performance while minimizing licensing fees?

discussion.content: same question on different websites and each place gives different answers. this is brilliant!

comments.content: well to save money, you will go with a single processor with multiple cores, however you don't need 10 overclocked cores for an email server, so in my opinion it B

I’m still thinking it’s D. It says 8 hyper threaded cores but not how many physical cores and the question centers around citations for the licenses and I would take 10 cores for the same price. Anyone else? I’m not sure I understand the Comptia logic.
you are absolutely correct, The correct answer is B
Not D because overclocking voids any warranty and for sure will turn out disastrous if not handled properly

discussion.content: he licensing agreement specifies a flat per-socket licensing fee, which means that the cost of the license is based on the number of processors (sockets) in the system, regardless of the number of cores or threads. Therefore, to minimize licensing fees while still achieving good performance, the technician should prioritize a system with fewer sockets.
Clearly B. Single CPU to minimize costs, and then hyperthreaded cores so that you end up with 16 threads. Servers don't benefit as much from high core frequency vs what they do from thread count.

Selected Answer: D
the answer is D 
this option provides a high number of cores for performance while only incurring the flat per socket licensing fee for one processor rather than multiple processors
Correct Answer is D

Why is the answer not A?

2 cores with 6 hyperthreaded cores (2 cores each) = 24 cores

8 hyperthreaded cores gives you 16 cores...

So surely A is correct?

comments.content: 2 cores is more expensive, you should minimize the costs, so i think its B

discussion.content: 8 hyper threaded cores = 16 cores so it's B.
an overclocked cpu is not something you want for a server who prioritize stability, also is obviously not a wise choice cause in the long run will die before then a regular one
After a bit of research, the correct answer is D. A single-processor motherboard with ten overclocked cores.
correct Answer is D:A single-processor motherboard with ten overclocked cores

im Betreiben von Komponenten außerhalb ihrer Spezifikationen erlischt in nahezu allen Fällen die Garantie des Herstellers. Auch kann die Lebenserwartung der übertakteten Bauteile mitunter signifikant sinken.

Durch einen höheren Takt und vor allem die erhöhte Spannung wird die Elektromigration begünstigt, was z. B. als Sudden Northwood Death Syndrome bekannt wurde. Die Verlustleistung steigt linear mit dem Takt und quadratisch mit der Spannung.

Eine weitere Gefahrenquelle ist die entstehende Hitze beim Übertakten. Während bei älteren CPU-Modellen zu hohes Übertakten bzw. zu wenig Kühlung oder Kühlungsausfälle zu Überhitzungsschäden führte, gibt es heute eine Technik namens Throttling („drosseln“), die verhindert, dass der Prozessor zu heiß wird, indem sie Takte einfach auslässt. Dies kann jedoch dazu führen

deshalb sage ich auch B

choices.B: Install the printer on the users' desktops and point it to the IP address of the manager's computer.
choices.A: Create a share on the manager's computer and give the users rights to the share.
choices.D: Provide flash drives to the users so they can transfer data to the manager's computer for printing.
choices.C: Purchase a wireless printer so the users can access the printer via the network.

questions.question_text:
A printer stops working in the billing department and cannot be repaired. A new printer has been ordered and a technician is tasked with allowing other users to print to the billing manager's printer until the new printer arrives. The manager's printer is currently used via USB connection, and there are no network jacks available for use.
Which of the following is the BEST way for the technician to allow access to the printer?

discussion.content: Correct answer should be A
how C is the right answer when the question says : ""technician is tasked with allowing other users to print to the billing manager printer until the new printer arrives"" ???

comments.content: you would then have to wait on that printer to come in too.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Remember that printer connected to manager's PC by USB . only option is to share this printer and on users PC s allows to use this printer. I've done this many times in real working environment when there is no spear network ports

Selected Answer: A
It's A I did printer deployment job and if a printer server went down we would have them access the nearest USB printer

comments.content:
More importantly the question states "until the new printer arrives."

You aren't going to buy a wireless printer to let people print again while you wait for their replacement printer to arrive.

discussion.content: "the BEST way for the technician to allow access to the printer?" i'd like to underline "to allow access to the printer". By purchasing a new wireless printer you may be print again but you won't allow access to the printer (that is already in the office), so no, C can't be the answer

A is correct . Remember that printer connected to manager's PC by USB . only option is to share this printer and on users PC s allows to use this printer. I've done this many times in real working environment when there is no spear network ports
So A is right!

You’d probably get fired if you went and bought another printer with one already on the way… Maybe they shouldn’t have ordered one and just went and bought it in the first place. Frustrating.(Got this from another site)

comments.content: "the BEST way for the technician to allow access to the printer?" i'd like to underline "to allow access to a printer". By purchasing a new wireless printer you may be print again but you won't allow access to the printer (that is already in the office)

discussion.content:
Remember, multiple users should print and creating a share is convenient for a small users, especially on a homegroup. the wireless printer will support many users. Also, creating a share printer will only work when the main computer is turned and stop working when turned off. The correct answer is , purchasing
 a wireless printer.
why are you purchasing a wireless printer when there is one ordered already?Are we not making a plan to print while waiting for a new one(the one ordered?

The correct answer is A! Create a share folder on the computer is obvious. I confirmed this on another website that is recommended for students preparing for the 1001 exam. I would provide the website if exam topics allowed me to. The website is given to us by the school I attend where I've taken the A+ course prep.

I was confused too. But I think I can justify the answer, the question was 'which is best' so it doesn't matter if it costs more or waste of resources or time, a wireless printer is the best option. I hope it makes sense. Let me know if any of you agree?
Folks, the correct is 'A'. Move on.

comments.content: I take it back, it could be the the option C meant to say PRINT SERVER instead of PRINTER. If so, then the given answer would be correct.

discussion.content: There is no most correct answer in the list but A seems to be the most appropriate way to handle this situation out of all.
It's supposed to say purchase a printer SERVER, not a printer

The answer is A i have done this at work several times, go to printers and scanners on the managers pc, then select the installed printer, then right click then go to properties and then share the printer. Then on the users go to search and search by the ip address or the computer name then will see the printer and connect.

So I spoke with my instructor and this was his exact response for the correct answer being "C" "As silly as it sounds answer C is the BEST option as the others break security protocols (A,D) and would impact the managers productivity."

The answer is A, he's already ordered a new printer, so basically the answer they've selected as the correct answer is a step he's already taken, in the meantime until such time that printer arrives the staff still need to print, so logically creating a share on the manager's printer is the correct answer.

Answer C should have been
"Purchase a wireless print server so the users can access the printer via network."

They mistaken put in there Wireless Printer instead of a Wireless Printer Server. A Wireless Printer Server would be much cheaper than a printer and it would make the manager's current USB printer be accessible over the network wireless.
Then why order a printer in the first place, if you are just going to purchase a printer
the right answer is A
